attributes.action: Re-run the EU referendum so that 16 and 17 year olds can vote
attributes.additional_details:
16/17 year old Scots could vote in the 2014 independence referendum, so there is a UK precedence that should have been followed. The response given to this petition (https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/119706) was unfair for that reason, and for the following, which underline some rights of 16/17 y.o, many of which are subject to EU law.

pay income tax/NI
obtain tax credits/benefits 
get married/enter civil partnership
be a company director
join armed forces
consent to medical treatment
attributes.background: 16 & 17 year olds can legally do many things. i.e., they have NI numbers and can work. Being directly impacted by EU law, their denial of a vote means the result was not inclusive. As such, the referendum should be re-run so that the eventual outcome is fully comprehensive of the entire UK opinion.
